page.title: 01MANSELL LACY SOUTHWARD
page.content: Mansell Lacy lies on the edge of a gently valley N.W. of Hereford with fertile fields and pasture draining in the Yazor Brook. The highest ground is forested with predominantly coniferous pines interspread with clumps of hardwoods such as oak, beech and ash. The steeper fields running down from the woods are generally pasture soon giving way to arable crops such as cereals, potatoes, sugar beet and oil seed rape. The grass fields support mostly sheep and beef cattle with a little dairy farming with both hay and silage being made for winter feeding. A yeoman farming area supporting and employing craftsmen in modern farming and forestry it retains many features of the Landed Estate with keepered shoots, reared pheasants and abundant wild life. The area is rich in flora and faune especially birds and deer.
